extractions.title: Investigating the Shared Genetic Architecture Between Kidney Function and Alzheimer's Disease Across Ancestries

extractions.trait: Alzheimer's disease (AD) - local regions (EUR)
extractions.method_detail: LAVA (local heritability / local genetic correlation) reported in paper; authors also used LDSC for genome-wide analyses. Summary-statistics based.
extractions.source_text: In EUR, 52 regions showed significant local correlations (Bonferroni‐corrected), and heritability (AD: h² = 0.05, p ≈ 0.025; eGFR: h² = 0.10, p < 1E‐10).
extractions.evidence_html: ...ificant (r g values ≈ 0.07) in both ancestries, with regions of strong local correlations observed. In EUR, 52 regions showed significant local correlations (Bonferroni‐corrected), and heritability (AD: h² = 0.05, p ≈ 0.025; eGFR: h² = 0.10, p < 1E‐10). These regions exhibited balanced bidirectional correlations (26 loci each; positive range: 0.32 to ...

extractions.title: Integrated genetic analysis of Alzheimer's disease and stroke subtypes: insights from LDSC, PLACO, and MR studies.

extractions.trait: Alzheimer's disease (AD)
extractions.method_detail: Paper states as an estimate (cited): "these common genetic variants account for about 24% of the variance in AD". The study uses LDSC for analyses, but this 24% value is presented in the Discussion as a previously estimated value (refs [41,42]) and no SE or method-specific detail for this number is provided in the text.
extractions.ancestry: European (LDSC used 1000 Genomes European reference; GWAS cohorts are primarily European-derived)
extractions.source_text: Complex diseases like AD and IS are largely influenced by the collective impact of numerous common genetic variants, with each variant contributing a minor portion of the overall risk [ 40 ], it is es
extractions.evidence_html: ...mber of variants ( HDAC9 ) affecting the specific stroke subtypes have been identified [ 38 , 39 ]. Complex diseases like AD and IS are largely influenced by the collective impact of numerous common genetic variants, with each variant contributing a minor portion of the overall risk [ 40 ], it is estimated that these common genetic variants account for about 24% of the variance in AD and about 18% in stroke [ 41 , 42 ]. QQ plot analysis confirmed the quality and potential bias of the GWAS results, revealing that the o...

extractions.trait: Stroke (any stroke / stroke overall)
extractions.method_detail: Paper states as an estimate (cited): "these common genetic variants account for ... about 18% in stroke". The study used LDSC for other analyses, but the 18% figure is reported in Discussion referencing prior estimates (refs [41,42]); no SE or method detail for this number is given in the text.
extractions.ancestry: European (LDSC used 1000 Genomes European reference; stroke GWAS meta-analysis cohorts are predominantly European)
extractions.source_text: Complex diseases like AD and IS are largely influenced by the collective impact of numerous common genetic variants, with each variant contributing a minor portion of the overall risk [ 40 ], it is es
extractions.evidence_html: ...mber of variants ( HDAC9 ) affecting the specific stroke subtypes have been identified [ 38 , 39 ]. Complex diseases like AD and IS are largely influenced by the collective impact of numerous common genetic variants, with each variant contributing a minor portion of the overall risk [ 40 ], it is estimated that these common genetic variants account for about 24% of the variance in AD and about 18% in stroke [ 41 , 42 ]. extractions.title: Alzheimer disease is (sometimes) highly heritable: Drivers of variation in heritability estimates for binary traits, a systematic review.

extractions.trait: Late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD)
extractions.method_detail: Lee et al. 2013 GCTA/GREML (reported as 'resulting LOAD heritability estimate of 24% based on a sample of 7,139 participants (3,290 cases, 3,849 controls)')
extractions.source_text: The first LOAD GCTA heritability estimates were published in 2013 ( Table 2 and Fig 3 ). The resulting LOAD heritability estimate of 24% was based on a sample of 7,139 participants (3,290 cases, 3,849
extractions.evidence_html: ...ML) procedure. We identified seven LOAD heritability studies that employed this method ( Table 2 ). The first LOAD GCTA heritability estimates were published in 2013 ( Table 2 and Fig 3 ). The resulting LOAD heritability estimate of 24% was based on a sample of 7,139 participants (3,290 cases, 3,849 controls) that included both elderly screened and population controls [ 71 , 72 ]. Concurrently, Ridge et al. (2013) leveraged the Alzheimer’s Disease Genetics Consortium (ADGC) data...

extractions.trait: Late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD)
extractions.method_detail: Ridge et al. 2016 GCTA update using 30 ADGC studies (required non-missing data across 21 known AD genes)
extractions.source_text: A 2016 update included data from 30 studies within the ADGC, and the heritability estimate increased to 53%. This study included only 9,699 individuals (3,877 cases, 5,822 controls) [ 75 ].
extractions.evidence_html: .... The ADGC dataset has since continued to expand, facilitating more comprehensive analyses of LOAD. A 2016 update included data from 30 studies within the ADGC, and the heritability estimate increased to 53%. This study included only 9,699 individuals (3,877 cases, 5,822 controls) [ 75 ]. This sample size was smaller in this latter study due to the requirement for non-missing data acros...

extractions.evidence_html: ... Clinical diagnosis have inherent misdiagnosis rates [ 83 ] that can affect heritability estimates. extractions.title: Similarities and differences between Alzheimer's disease and schizophrenia: drug target Mendelian randomization and transcriptome analysis.

extractions.trait: Alzheimer's disease (AD)
extractions.method_detail: Linkage Disequilibrium Score Regression (LDSC) was performed to estimate heritability and genetic correlation. The provided text does not report numeric SNP-heritability (h2), SE, LDSC intercept, or lambda_GC values.
